question: Do you understand the enterprise-wide risk appetite for your applications ?
Do you have a strategic plan for application security and use it to make decisions?
Do you regularly review and update the Strategic Plan for Application Security?
Do you use a set of metrics to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of the application security program across applications?
answer: Yes, for all three metrics categories
comments: We have several metrics that are followed up on a  monthly basis in SA BSS covering people and org,  product and customer

question: Did you define Key Perfomance Indicators (KPI) from available application security metrics?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the metrics

question: Do you update the Application Security strategy and roadmap based on application security metrics and KPIs?
Do you have and apply a common set of policies and standards throughout your organization?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications
comments: We incorporate standards into TEA, our own guidelines and checklists

question: Do you publish the organization's policies as test scripts or run-books for easy interpretation by development teams?
comments: We run a large number of tests. Don't know to what extent  they cover architecture and guidelines

question: Do you regularly report on policy and standard compliance, and use that information to guide compliance improvement efforts?
answer: Yes, we report at regular times
comments: We report for each release and also for the monthly follow up

question: Do you have a complete picture of your external compliance obligations?
Do you have a standard set of security requirements and verification procedures addressing the organization's external compliance obligations?
Do you regularly report on adherence to external compliance obligations and use that information to guide efforts to close compliance gaps?
Do you require employees involved with application development to take SDLC training?
comments: We do security boot camp and also train all staff every 12 months in secure coding

question: Is training customized for individual roles such as developers, testers, or security champions?
answer: Yes, for at least half of the training

question: Have you implemented a Learning Management System or equivalent to track employee training and certification processes?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the training
comments: We track the completion and coverage of mentioned trainings

question: Have you identified a Security Champion for each development team?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the teams
comments: We have a security master in each dev team who  participates in boot camp

question: Does the organization have a Secure Software Center of Excellence (SSCE)?
Is there a centralized portal where developers and application security professionals from different teams and business units are able to communicate and share information?
Do you classify applications according to business risk based on a simple and predefined set of questions?
answer: Yes, most or all of them

question: Do you use centralized and quantified application risk profiles to evaluate business risk?
Do you regularly review and update the risk profiles for your applications?
Do you identify and manage architectural design flaws with threat modeling?
Do you use a standard methodology, aligned on your application risk levels?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you regularly review and update the threat modeling methodology for your applications?
Do project teams specify security requirements during development?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you define, structure, and include prioritization in the artifacts of the security requirements gathering process?
answer: Yes, most or all of the time
comments: We have a large number of generic security requirements

question: Do you use a standard requirements framework to streamline the elicitation of security requirements?
comments: No specifc consideration to fintech in the sec GPRs I believe

question: Do stakeholders review vendor collaborations for security requirements and methodology?
answer: Yes, most or all of the time

question: Do vendors meet the security responsibilities and quality measures of service level agreements defined by the organization?
answer: Yes, most or all of the time

question: Are vendors aligned with standard security controls and software development tools and processes that the organization utilizes?
answer: Yes, most or all of the time

question: Do teams use security principles during design?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you use shared security services during design?
comments: don't know what security services are

question: Do you base your design on available reference architectures?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you evaluate the security quality of important technologies used for development?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you have a list of recommended technologies for the organization?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the technology domains
comments: E.g. Which encryption algorithms to use

question: Do you enforce the use of recommended technologies within the organization?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Is your full build process formally described?
Is the build process fully automated?
Do you enforce automated security checks in your build processes?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you have solid knowledge about dependencies you're relying on?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you handle 3rd party dependency risk by a formal process?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you prevent build of software if it's affected by vulnerabilities in dependencies?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you use repeatable deployment processes?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Are deployment processes automated and employing security checks?
Do you consistently validate the integrity of deployed artifacts?
Do you limit access to application secrets according to the least privilege principle?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you inject production secrets into configuration files during deployment?
Do you practice proper lifecycle management for application secrets?
Do you track all known security defects in accessible locations?
Do you keep an overview of the state of security defects across the organization?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications
comments: We gave a view of existing vulnerabilities and SLAs

question: Do you enforce SLAs for fixing security defects?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications
comments: We gave a view of existing vulnerabilities and SLAs

question: Do you use basic metrics about recorded security defects to carry out quick win improvement activities?
Do you improve your security assurance program upon standardized metrics?
Do you regularly evaluate the effectiveness of your security metrics so that its input helps drive your security strategy?
Do you review the application architecture for key security objectives on an ad-hoc basis?
Do you regularly review the security mechanisms of your architecture?
Do you regularly review the effectiveness of the security controls?
Do you review the application architecture for mitigations of typical threats on an ad-hoc basis?
Do you regularly evaluate the threats to your architecture?
Do you regularly update your reference architectures based on architecture assessment findings?
Do you test applications for the correct functioning of standard security controls?
answer: Yes, most or all of them
comments: We do regular assessments using a supplier

question: Do you consistently write and execute test scripts to verify the functionality of security requirements?
Do you automatically test applications for security regressions?
comments: We have plans to introduce SoV

question: Do you test applications using randomization or fuzzing techniques?
Do you create abuse cases from functional requirements and use them to drive security tests?
Do you perform denial of service and security stress testing?
Do you scan applications with automated security testing tools?
answer: Yes, most or all of them

question: Do you customize the automated security tools to your applications and technology stacks?
Do you integrate automated security testing into the build and deploy process?
Do you manually review the security quality of selected high-risk components?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the components

question: Do you perform penetration testing for your applications at regular intervals?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you use the results of security testing to improve the development lifecycle?
answer: Yes, but we improve it ad-hoc

question: Do you analyze log data for security incidents periodically?
Do you follow a documented process for incident detection?
Do you review and update the incident detection process regularly?
Do you respond to detected incidents?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the incidents

question: Do you use a repeatable process for incident handling?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the incident types

question: Do you have a dedicated incident response team available?
answer: Yes, most or all of the time

question: Do you harden configurations for key components of your technology stacks?
Do you have hardening baselines for your components?
Do you monitor and enforce conformity with hardening baselines?
Do you identify and patch vulnerable components?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the components

question: Do you follow an established process for updating components of your technology stacks?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the components

question: Do you regularly evaluate components and review patch level status?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the components

question: Do you protect and handle information according to protection requirements for data stored and processed on each application?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you maintain a data catalog, including types, sensitivity levels, and processing and storage locations?
Do you regularly review and update the data catalog and your data protection policies and procedures?
Do you identify and remove systems, applications, application dependencies, or services that are no longer used, have reached end of life, or are no longer actively developed or supported?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the applications

question: Do you follow an established process for removing all associated resources, as part of decommissioning of unused systems, applications, application dependencies, or services?
answer: Yes, at least half of the time
comments: We have a phase out process, which could be more  actively used

question: Do you regularly evaluate the lifecycle state and support status of every software asset and underlying infrastructure component, and estimate their end of life?
answer: Yes, for most or all of the assets
